title: jannas ult  and assists
body: why doesnt jannas ult grant an assist if you use it to knock someone into your team and they get killed?

replies.body: Are there particular circumstances in which you're seeing Janna's ult knock enemies away but not apply assists? I just had a quick look at Janna's ult and it's both set up to apply assists in the spell's script on the knockback and is doing so in game.

> [{quoted}](name=Boku no Pokemon,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=AdQEUQQA,comment-id=0005000000000000,timestamp=2015-05-03T00:20:27.262+0000)
>
> well they did that to trundle pillar

Because they specifically *didn't* want him to have an initiation tool that wouldn't pull tower agro. Trundle's a tanky initiator, Janna's an utility disengage. I fail to see how something that works for one has anything to do with the other, considering how vastly different their kits are.

That's like saying {{champion:80}}'s should make a global sound alert when he starts his ulti because it allows him to travel about the same distance as {{champion:421}}/{{champion:14}}.
It does create a giant circle where he is going.  Seems like a very similar mechanic to me.
Similar, but different. That is key here.
Yes, and Janna's ult and Trundle's pillar are similar, but different.  They both control enemy movement, but one doesn't always give you an assist when you use it to help kill someone.

Rek'Sai's and Sion's ults both have that global sound alert, but their ults are very different.  Rek can only go to particular points on the map, while Sion can go anywhere he has a reasonably straight line towards.  Rek's has a channel, Sion just starts running.  Rek's is only mobility, Sion's hits like a truck and provides strong cc.  Rek's is global range, while Sion's ult is very restricted in where and how far it can go.

I was mostly just pointing out that very different abilities have similar mechanics tacked on to show that the Pantheon argument is irrelevant.  All three of those ults have something that says "Here I come", just in different ways.  The Sion/Rek'Sai case just shows a really good example of _different abilities_ with the _exact same mechanic_ tacked on.
